title: What are the differences and similarities between Kant and Ross Deontology ethics? - Quora

response.answer_text: Important takeaways from Kant: Human dignity is at the heart of ethics.The central role of the Golden Rule as the backbone or loose structure of at the main three categorical imperatives.I’m not sure to the extent that procedural justice in the Western tradition is sourced in Kantian ethics, but that seems significant as well.There is much more, but these are the highlights. In terms of W.D. Ross I see him putting a bit more virtue ethics spin on ethics—by clarifying what our “prima facia duties” are. For instance, this list helps clarify: A Simple Ethical Theory Based on W. D. Ross
